page.title: 07YOUTH OPPORTUNITIES, RUGELEY
page.content: Because youth unemployment is so high in 1985, the Government has introduced a Youth Training Scheme (YTS). The aim is to train school leavers with few or no qualifications in a useful skill to equip them for finding a full time job. There is a Careers Office and Job Centre in Rugeley but these cannot overcome the basic problem of the shortage of jobs. Most teenagers in Rugeley stay at school as long as they can, to get extra qualifications, or they go to the Colleges of Further Education at Cannock or Stafford. Few are able to find a full time job immediately on leaving school. Some do not try to find work and are content to live at home on Social Security payments. Generally young people in Rugeley think that job prospects are bleak but they may be improved when new jobs are attracted to the area.
